name: Abyz
flavorText: Its thick, complex atmosphere is inhospitable to most races, but Abyz is known for its seemingly endless natural reserves of rare minerals and precious metals.

name: Fria
flavorText: Brutally cold ice world populated only by a few scattered mining camps. Despite brutal climate, highly prized for its deposits of rare ores used in starship drives.

name: Arinam
flavorText: Isolated planet poor in resources but rich in natural beauty. Boasts many exotic resorts frequented by the rich and famous of the galaxy.

name: Meer
flavorText: Hellish world immolated in the inferno of its nearby sun. Famed for the fiery majesty of its surface when viewed from the safety of its many orbital stations.

name: Arnor
flavorText: Lush, green world that is renowned for some of the most fertile soil in the galaxy. Dominated by endless fields and the processing facilities of large agricultural firms.

name: Lor
flavorText: Wreathed in vast seas of methane ice. Sea floor drilling platforms harvest rare crystals used in advance computers and energy weapons.

name: Bereg
flavorText: A frozen world that is inhospitable to most races. Indentured laborers risk attacks from arctic sharaks in the infamous Iodinium mines.

name: Lirta IV
flavorText: Covered in vast swamps and fetid bogs. Home to rare biochemical compounds unique to its marshlands used in everything from exotic foods to biogenic drugs.

name: Centauri
flavorText: Venerable world with few resources but a rich history. Site of important treaties between several races during the Twilight Wars.

name: Gral
flavorText: Backwater planet with modest resources and an unassuming populace. Most noted for the reliable and affordable vehicles produced in its factories.

name: Coorneeq
flavorText: Former garden world that has subsequently enjoyed increased industrialization. Home to the esteemed Free Worlds Academy of Military Science and Research.

name: Resculon
flavorText: Poor in natural resources, but a nearby nexus of major trade routes has brought it increasing wealth as interstellar commerce has intensified.

name: Dal Bootha
flavorText: A populous planet whose resources have been severely depleted. Well-educated citizenry and many universities, but dependent on foreign imports.

name: Xxehan
flavorText: Known for genetically complex native lifeforms adapted to tainted atmosphere and biochemistry.

name: Lazar
flavorText: The only inhabited world in a forgettable system. Few native resources and only rudimentary, often underdeveloped, industries.

name: Sakulag
flavorText: Jungle planet plagued by dangerous predators such as the arboreal razeden. Home to many exotic biochemicals and natural pharmaceuticals.

name: Lodor
flavorText: Wealthy planet ruled by powerful biotech consortiums. Rumored to harbor hidden caches of outlawed bacterial weapons.

name: Mehar Xull
flavorText: Unstable radiation belts create hazardous living conditions but facilitate research in the electro-quantum propulsion technologies.

name: Mellon
flavorText: Poor in natural resources but rich in exotic plant and animal life. Protected as a planetary xenological garden and lifeform preserve.

name: Zohbat
flavorText: Known for its highly intoxicating Zohlian whiskey and the planetary space elevator that links the surface with orbital stations and shipyards.

name: New Albion
flavorText: Rare atmospheric composition and biochemistry support lifeforms unlike any others in the galaxy.

name: Starpoint
flavorText: Large planet with eight small moons that supply a wide range of valuable resources. Acidic rains and toxic storms make it an unappealing destination for tourists.

name: Quann
flavorText: Since the discovery of the Alpha Wormhole, this temperate planet with two continents and one large ocean has been a haven for traders and smugglers alike.

name: Qucen'n
flavorText: After the Twilight Wars, existed for centuries as a near-utopia of scattered communal farms free from governmental interference.

name: Rarron
flavorText: Large, populous world with three distinctive moons renowned for its biomodification clinics and cyber boutiques.

name: Saudor
flavorText: Prosperous planet with large native population and substantial industry. Extreme axial tilt results in long day-night cycle that some races find uncomfortable.

name: Tar'Mann
flavorText: Small, isolated planet with small population and modest resources. Most famous for its delicious avinberries.

name: Tequ'ran
flavorText: Desolate planet transformed into weapons testing facility for large defense consortiums.

name: Torkan
flavorText: Populous planet almost completely dependent on foreign imports to sustain the extravagant lifestyles of its citizens.

name: Thibah
flavorText: Burdened by overpopulation and low mineral content in the planetary crust. Historically used as a staging world for deep-space exploration and trade.

name: Vefut II
flavorText: Massive, rocky world cursed with extreme gravity. Underground cities support advanced research in antigravity technologies.

name: Wellon
flavorText: Sky cities suspended in helium-rich atmosphere more noted for fantastic views than the small quantities of exotic elements harvested by their chemical mines.

name: Mecatol Rex
flavorText: Once a splendid place, now a sad devastated wasteland. Only the radiation-shielded Mecatol city, the seat of the powerful Galactic Council, remains habitable.

name: Mecatol Rex
ability: You may exhaust this card and discard 1 secret objective at the end of your turn to draw 1 secret objective.
flavorText: Once a splendid place, now a sad devastated wasteland. Only the radiation-shielded Mecatol city, the seat of the powerful Galactic Council, remains habitable.

name: Archon Vail
flavorText: A former Xxcha colony, its extremely low temperatures create exotic molecular compounds that give the world its famed violet hue. Orbital facilities use the compounds in high-energy stardrive research.

name: Perimeter
flavorText: Former garrison world with fond memories of the Lazax. Maintains formidable military with informal ties to the Winnu. Perpendicular rings make orbital navigation difficult.

name: Ang
flavorText: High rotational speed creates extremely energized magnetosphere. Orbital taps use this to energize starship fuels and power labs developing new beam weapons.

name: Sem-Lore
flavorText: Home to the Semanora, and heavily damaged in the Twilight Wars. Rustling warship hulks litter the rod-deserts, making it a war memorial and salvage site.

name: Vorhal
flavorText: This icy world is wreathed by powerful storms, forcing inhabitants to live underground in geothermal vents. Pacifistic locals award yearly "peace prizes" to peacemakers across the galaxy.

name: Atlas
flavorText: Heavy grav world and former Sol colony famed for squat, strong inhabitants and strategic location. Visitors need support exoskeletons to move on the surface.

name: Primor
flavorText: Large temperate world. Site of several pitched battles during the Twilight Wars due to valuable osmium deposits and a well-educated populace.

name: Hope's End
flavorText: Buried in the Ichal Nebula. The Lazax used the toxic wildlife and fierce aurora storms to train their troops. Even now, volatile weapon caches remain hidden beneath its sands.

name: Cormund
flavorText: A remote and sparsely settled Naaz-Rokha world destroyed during early entropic field tests. Now mining corporations harvest metals from the shattered core.

name: Everra
flavorText: Ancient world of red seas and bare rocks. Locals live in wondrous nano-carbon cities built by a mysterious ancient race, and mine nearby nebulae for rare gases.

name: Jeol Ir
flavorText: Heavily industrialized world. Pollution has killed all life outside of dome cities, but twin suns provide constant power for factories and huge populace.

name: Accoen
flavorText: Populace lives on continent sized fungal rafts that float atop a soupy, world-spanning ocean of useful bio-compounds. Popular research site for biologists.

name: Kraag
flavorText: A heavily irradiated world known only for its dust mines. Recently a massive "tomb" of dormant Titans was discovered in the southern hemisphere.

name: Siig
flavorText: World covered in frozen, cesium-laced oceans. Archives buried deep beneath the surface use the cold to preserve relics and operate massive computers.

name: Ba'kal
flavorText: Dry, rocky deserts stretch from pole to pole. Shield cities protect against sandstorms while supplying nomadic harvester crawlers that mine the barrens for salt compounds.

name: Alio Prima
flavorText: Wet planet covered in rivers, lakes and small seas but no oceans. Dry poles provide haven from constant floods. Numerous farms famous for luxury foodstuffs.

name: Lisis
flavorText: Primordial world with primitive native life. Potential for terraforming led to the infamous genocide of Saar settlements by Sardakk N'orr and ongoing conflicts between them and Naalu forces.

name: Velnor
flavorText: Barren world of windswept rocks and thick, murky oceans. Lack of local lifeforms allows corporations to strip-mine the surface and test orbital kinetic weapons at the poles.

name: Cealdri
flavorText: Small cities huddle on the shores of the single ocean and avoid the arid continental interiors. Mentak ships hunt departing vessels carrying bespoke cybernetics.

name: Xanhact
flavorText: Rebelled during the end of the Lazax Empire, and was bombarded to ash by a Lazax fleet as an example. Left by the Galactic Council as a memorial to Lazax tyranny.

name: Vega Major
flavorText: Most of the population resides in orbital habitats supporting mining operations in the planetary ring. Surface colonization limited due to oceanic macrosquid infestations.

name: Vega Minor
flavorText: Famous for extremely shallow seas covering most of the surface and for the renowned Vega Propulsion Corporation. Stilt cities host vibrant multi-species populations.

name: Abaddon
flavorText: A temperate planet whose low gravity allows for stunningly tall mountain ranges. Serves as a stop-over for trade routes to the nearby Vorish Cluster.

name: Ashtroth
flavorText: Covered in boggy landmasses and shallow seas. Algal blooms provide rich biomass for processed foods, but create smelly (and often toxic) offgassing.

name: Loki
flavorText: Cold and wracked with violent storms, Loki still hosts several Yssaril and human colonies, some of which have engaged in escalating shadow-conflicts.

name: Rigel I
flavorText: Hot, innermost world of the Rigel system. Cities and native life cluster inland from the heavily alkaline oceans.

name: Rigel II
flavorText: Temperate world with expansive oceans. Covered in estates and resorts for the system's elite, with extensive fisheries that feed much of the rest of the system.

name: Rigel III
flavorText: Outermost world of the Rigel system, and extensively settled despite cooler climates. Boasts a diverse range of industries and research institutions.

name: Mallice
notes: Part of the Wormhole Nexus tile
flavorText: Trapped in a space believed to be beyond our universe, a shimmering world of strange energies and disconcerting warping of physical laws sitting at the heart of a strategically vital wormhole nexus.

name: Mirage
notes: Placed when the Mirage frontier card is drawn
flavorText: Exists on no known charts and appears deserted to those who stumble across it. However, secretive locals live in cloaked cities heavily defended by swarms of starfighters.

name: Lesab
flavorText: Lesab is either a resounding success or dangerous failure of terraforming, with its surface now dominated by a semi-sentient fungus.

name: Olergodt
flavorText: Olergodt's dozen moons create dramatic and dangerous tides, but also host a bustling mining industry.

name: The Watchtower
flavorText: Sporting methods of construction found nowhere else in the known galaxy, the Watchtower's origin is unknown. Some of its occupants have been standing watch there for countless generations.

name: Vira-Pics III
flavorText: The atmosphere on Vira-Pics III is so dense that no trace of the rugged civilization clinging to life on the planet's surface is visible from orbit.

name: Andeara
flavorText: Located deep in Shaleri space, the formerly isolated shikrai outpost on Andeara serves as a key access point to those wishing to do business with the Creuss.

name: Lemox
flavorText: Its twin space elevators are marvels of engineering, but industry on the planet came to a grinding halt when local spacetime collapsed.

name: Emelpar
flavorText: The legendary ruins on Emelpar's moons must certainly date to before the Lazax, but no other trace of this vanished civilization remains.

name: Faunus
flavorText: Faunus is ecologically rich, which supports the controversial biogenetics research of the Maxis order.

name: Garbozia
flavorText: Once an Imperial dumping ground, the mixture of mineral and chemical waste on Garbozia has become a resource - and a hazard - of its own.

name: Tempesta
flavorText: The frozen halo in Tempesta's sky is a potent fuel for reaction drives. The planet itself is virtually uninhabitable.

name: Industrex
flavorText: With an unusually strong planetary magnetosphere, Industrex also sports an active and quite beautiful atmosphere full of auroras.

name: Capha
flavorText: The green zones maintain a stable atmosphere, but Capha's lack of a magnetosphere means that its breathable air is swiftly stripped by cosmic wind.

name: Kostboth
flavorText: Kostboth is an infant planet, not yet cooled from its formation. A tiny community of poets and scientists lives in orbit, chronicling the planet's first era.

name: Cresius
flavorText: The techno-anchorites of the Grovian Order forbid mining of their "sacred planet" but the world is so toxic few would try anyway.

name: Lazul Rex
flavorText: Once a subsector capital, Lazul Rex has somehow endured the Twilight Wars unscathed with a fully functional government and economy.

name: Hercalor
flavorText: Overfarming devastated Hercalor's biosphere. Now the planet is a haven for rogues and pirates.

name: Tiamat
flavorText: Blessed with both a productive biome and exploitable mineral wealth, Tiamat is peaceful but surprisingly uninterested in galactic affairs.

name: New Terra
flavorText: Explorers were surprised to discover that this apparently lifeless rock has a rich fungal ecosystem in its interior, eating radiation from the planetoid's heavy metal core.

name: Tinnes
flavorText: "Oceans" of black sand drift in the lowlands, forcing industry and most of the planet's biome to the frigid highlands.

name: Bellatrix
flavorText: Once devoted to war, Bellatrix was thoroughly demilitarized and now espouses a pacifist philosophy.

name: Tsion Station
flavorText: The people of Bellatrix converted Tsion Station into a haven for refugees in order to atone for their past warmongering.

name: Tarana
flavorText: Visitors are encouraged to wear UV-filtering eye protection at all times, which also color-corrects the vibrant planet to a more neutral palette.

name: Oluz Station
flavorText: Built by the Kieros and refitted by the Hylar, Oluz Station consists primarily of flooded compartments for aquatic species.

name: Horizon
flavorText: Horizon's biomes are heavily stratified by elevation, with shallow seas, lowland forests, and arid, rocky highlands. Strong air currents at higher altitudes may be responsible.

name: El'Nath
flavorText: El'nath's local magnetic field is so strong that metallic objects are repelled towards the sky. Specialized tools are required for mining and industrial operations.

name: Luthien VI
flavorText: A mid-sized gas giant with unusually rich gas clouds, Luthien VI's populace live in floating cities in a narrow habitable zone just below the outer layer.

name: Avernus
notes: Placed by the Embers of Muaat Stellar Genesis Breakthrough
flavorText: The first artificial world of this galactic age.

name: Cocytus
flavorText: Witness the end of a world, piece by glittering piece.

name: Styx
flavorText: Where light goes to die.

name: Lethe
flavorText: A planet riven by disaster, awaiting the final calamitous blow.

name: Phlegethon
flavorText: A ruined planet for a ruined universe.
